Pathfinding

Class Pathfinder

  • java.lang.Object
    • Pathfinding.Pathfinder

  • public class Pathfinder
extends java.lang.Object
    Performs the Djikstra path finding algorithm given a 2D Array of Tiles.

    • Field Summary

        private java.util.HashSet<Tile> visitedNodes
        The nodes visited in last path finding search

      • path

      • findEucl

        public static double findEucl(double x1,
                              double y1,
                              double x2,
                              double y2)
        Find the standard straight line Euclidean distance between two points.
        Parameters:
        x1 - x value for first point
        y1 - y value for first point
        x2 - x value for second point
        y2 - y value for second point
        Returns:
        the Euclidean distance

      • init

        public void init(java.awt.Point startingPoint,
                 java.awt.Point targetPoint,
                 Tile[][] house)
        Initializes a new path, frontier, and visitedNodes set. Adds the zombies starting point to the frontier, and begins the search
        Parameters:
        startingPoint - the zombie's current location
        targetPoint - the player's current location
        house - our tile grid map

      • doesPathExist

        public boolean doesPathExist()
        Returns:
        true, if previous search resulted in a path found

      • getPath

        public java.util.ArrayList<Tile> getPath()
        Returns:
        the path, null if no path exists.

      • cleanVisitedList

        private void cleanVisitedList(Tile[][] house)
        Wipes the information pertenent to the previous path finding search clean. Leaves only the x,y coordinates and the tiletype.
        Parameters:
        house - our tile grid map

      • Dijkstra

        private void Dijkstra(java.awt.Point targetPoint,
                      Tile[][] house)
        Valid moves are north, south, east, west. Given a node, check these four locations. If the cost of a newfound node is greater than 15, discard it. Else, if it either hasn't been found before or if the newCost is greater than it's older cost, set it with the newCost and add it to the frontier. If a path is found, set pathExists to true. Else, set it to false.
        Parameters:
        targetPoint - the target/player's location
        house - our map
